Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We are given several tables and we need to produce an event log for process mining. Steps: 1. We will use order_id as the case identifier.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: 2. We will derive events from each table: - Orders Table: Order Created - Order Lines Table: For each item, we can have an Item Picked event. However, note that sometimes multiple items are picked at different times. We have two options: a) Create one event per item pick (with the same activity name but different timestamps and possibly different resources). b) Aggregate all item picks for an order into one event (using the latest or earliest time?). Since the problem says produce one event per activity if itâ€™s meaningful, or summarize if appropriate, and we have individual timestamps and picker_id for each item, it is meaningful to have one event per item pick. However, note that sometimes an order might have multiple items picked at the same time? But here they are at different times. We'll create an event for each row in the Order Lines table with activity Item Picked.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: - Delivery Table: We have two events per delivery: Order Dispatched and Order Arrived. However, note that an order can have multiple deliveries (like order 1002). We'll create two events for each delivery row: one for dispatch and one for arrival. - Invoice Table: Invoice Issued for each invoice. - Payments Table: Payment Received for each payment.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: 3. We will map timestamps from the respective tables. 4. We will combine the data by order_id and sort by timestamp. 5. We will include resources/actors where available: - For Order Created: We have sales_person_id (from Orders table) -> we can map to resource_id. - For Item Picked: We have picker_id (from Order Lines table). - For Order Dispatched and Order Arrived: We have carrier_id (from Delivery table). - For Invoice Issued: We have billing_person_id (from Invoice table). - For Payment Received: We don't have a direct resource, so we can leave blank or use payment method as an attribute.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Event 6: Payment Received (for each payment) - Case ID: order_id (we get this via the invoice_id, but note that the Payments table has invoice_id, and the Invoice table has order_id) We'll need to join Payments with Invoice to get the order_id.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: We'll create a list of events and then sort by (order_id, timestamp).

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We'll also include the resource_id and then optionally map to resource_name using the Resources table? ... Since the Resources table is provided, we can map the resource_id to the resource_name for readability. ... resource_map = {row['resource_id']: row['resource_name'] for row in Resources} Then for each event, if we have a resource_id, we can set the Resource column to the resource_name.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: We'll include the following columns in the event log: Case ID, Activity Name, Timestamp, Resource, Other Attributes For Other Attributes, we can include a string of key-value pairs, or we can have separate columns? ... We'll stick to one column for Other Attributes. ... construct the Other Attributes string accordingly.
